sources.title: "Tom, Tom, the Piper's Son" (1905) cinematographer Billy Bitzer
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems     This is a short preview. You can watch the whole film here: https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/index.php/gems-for-donation     "Tom, Tom, the Piper's Son" is a short comedy with unknown cast and director.  The film is included in our program to illustrate the work of our star Billy Bitzer. During a village fair Tom steals a pig and runs away with it chased by a crowd of persecutors.  The pig becomes unruly and hampers the escape, but the chasers have their own problem as they constantly stumble upon each other.  Will Tom take advantage and escape? Tom, Tom the Piper's Son Nursery Rhyme Words Tom Tom the piper's son, Stole a pig and away he ran. The pig was eat and Tom was beat, And Tom went crying down the street. metadata.Plot: Based loosely on the nursery rhyme: A fair is in progress, with refreshments, entertainment, and other activities. As the rest of the crowd is watching one of the acts, Tom steals a pig and runs off. He tries to hide, but he is chased by the crowd, and the pig also proves difficult to control. But Tom has some tricks up his sleeve that might give him a chance to escape.
